Sentencas: Solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) have attracted attention as clean and efficient energy conversion devices with low emissions.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: However, several degradation mechanisms limit the electrochemical performance of current SOFCs, with cathode degradation due to Cr-poisoning from metal interconnects particularly problematic.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: The acidity/ basicity of binary additives has been found to be a sensitive descriptor of the oxygen exchange kinetics, indi-cating that acidic Cr-species/basic Ca-species can be expected to deactivate/activate the cathode surface, respectively.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: Inspired by recent advances, the feasibility of relative acidity as a tool for reviving degraded SOFCs is demonstrated by neutralizing Cr-poisoned SOFCs by subsequent serial infiltration of Ca-species.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: A model mixed ionic and electronic conducting oxide, Pr0.1Ce0.9O2-delta (PCO), is selected as the cathode material.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: Area -specific resistances (ASR) of symmetric cells obtained by electrochemical impedance spectroscopy show that Cr-infiltration results in a seven-fold increase in ASR, while subsequent infiltration of Ca-species leads to com-plete recovery.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: Performance degradation and recovery are attributed to depressed/enhanced redox properties at the PCO surface, as supported by XPS analysis.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration

Sentencas: Experiments using anode-supported fuel cells show a reduction in peak power density by 26% upon Cr-infiltration, reversed following Ca-infiltration, after which no degradation is observed during subsequent operation for 100 h.
Titulo: Degradation and recovery of solid oxide fuel cell performance by control of cathode surface acidity: Case study-Impact of Cr followed by Ca infiltration
